metadata.feature_description: Add, edit, delete and moderate comments on wiki articles

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki article with comments section
steps.expected: Article page loads with comments section visible
steps.actual: Article 'Published Article Test - Jan 2026' loaded with Comments section visible

steps.action: Click 'Add a Comment' and type comment text
steps.expected: Comment input field becomes active and accepts text
steps.actual: Comment input activated, typed: 'This is a test comment added by Claude - January 9, 2026'

steps.action: Click Reply button to submit comment
steps.expected: Comment is posted and appears in comments list
steps.actual: Comment successfully posted and displayed in the comments section

steps.action: Click edit icon (pencil) on own comment
steps.expected: Edit menu appears with Edit option
steps.actual: Dropdown menu appeared with Edit and Remove options

steps.action: Click Edit and modify comment text
steps.actual: Comment entered edit mode, modified text to add '[EDITED]'

steps.expected: Edited comment is saved and displayed
steps.actual: Comment successfully updated with edited text

steps.action: Click edit icon on own comment and select Remove
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared asking to confirm deletion

steps.expected: Comment is removed from the list
steps.actual: Comment was successfully deleted and no longer appears in comments

steps.action: Click Reply link on an existing comment
steps.expected: Reply input field appears with @mention of original commenter
steps.actual: Reply field appeared with '@SuperUser Account' automatically populated

steps.expected: Reply is posted as a nested comment
steps.actual: Reply successfully posted showing @SuperUser Account mention and reply text

steps.expected: User mention (@username) is displayed as clickable link
steps.actual: @SuperUser Account displayed as a clickable link in the posted comment

steps.action: Add a comment with profanity words (damn, hell)
steps.expected: Comment is posted, profanity words may be filtered or comment rejected
steps.actual: Comment was posted successfully with profanity words unfiltered

steps.expected: Comment appears with or without filtered content
steps.actual: Comment displayed with words 'damn' and 'hell' intact - profanity filter not active or words not in filter list

issues: Profanity filter appears to be disabled or test words are not in the filter list

steps.action: As SuperUser (moderator), click edit icon on another user's comment
steps.actual: Edit and Remove options displayed for Anonymous user's comment, confirming moderator permissions

observations: Profanity filter functionality exists in the SocialLibrary base code but appears to be either disabled or the test words (damn, hell) are not in the configured filter list
Comment moderation approval workflow could not be tested as all comments auto-approved for SuperUser account - would require a non-moderator user account to test pending comment approval

Comment notifications were sent (code review confirms NewCommentNotifications and UserMentionNotificationsController are called) but notification center verification was outside scope of comments feature testing
Comments use contenteditable div elements rather than standard textarea inputs
